category: Things that can be 'broken' metaphorically or conceptually
explanation: Heart, law, silence, and code can all be 'broken' in a non-physical, conceptual, or metaphorical sense. A bone is typically only 'broken' in a literal, physical sense.

category: Fates of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World
explanation: Four of the tokens (Hanging Gardens of Babylon, Colossus of Rhodes, Lighthouse of Alexandria, Temple of Artemis at Ephesus) represent wonders of the ancient world that are no longer standing. The Great Pyramid of Giza is the only one of the original Seven Wonders that is still largely intact today.

Balloon, Rocket, Kite, and Elevator are all objects that are designed to or capable of moving upwards on their own. A Ladder is a stationary structure that a person climbs upwards, rather than moving upwards itself.
